body.p: Mr. Charles Dickens presents his compliments to Mr. Joseph Jones and begs through him to thank the Committee of the Hibernian Society,The Ancient Order of Hibernians, an Irish Catholic fraternal organisation; its American branch was founded in New York City in 1833. for their polite attention and kind invitation. It would have given Mr. Dickens great pleasure to accept it, but he leaves this cityPhiladelphia, where CD stayed from 5-9 March, before moving on to Washington. tomorrow morning and will be at [a]Word probably missing through a tear in the page. considerable distance from it on the seventeenth.
